ARABIC: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He - exalted be the Majesty of our Lord ! - has neither wife nor son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Exalted is the glory of our Lord; He has neither wife nor son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and that “He – exalted be His Majesty – has not taken to Himself either a wife or a son”;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: our Lord is too exalted to have either a wife or son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: ‘And that our Lord’s Majesty is Supreme – He has neither chosen a wife nor a child.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: `And He, exalted be the Jadd of our Lord, has taken neither a wife nor a son.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And that He-- exalted be the majesty of our Lord-- has not taken a consort, nor a son:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He -- exalted be our Lord's majesty! has not taken to Himself either consort or a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (we believe) that He - exalted be the glory of our Lord! - hath taken neither wife nor son,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and exalted is the majesty of our Lord, He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And He - exalted be the majesty of our Lord!-hath taken neither a spouse nor a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Exalted be the majesty of our Lord; He has taken neither any spouse nor son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And exalted be the Majesty of our Lord, He has taken neither a wife, nor a son (or offspring or children).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He exalted be the Majesty of our Lord, who has neither taken to Himself a wife, nor a son!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Exalted is the Grandeur of our Lord—He never had a mate, nor a child.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [72:3] And [we believe] that (annahu: the pronoun in this and in the next two instances is that of the matter) — exalted be the majesty of our Lord, transcendent is His majesty and magnificence above what is ascribed to Him — He has taken neither spouse nor son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And (we believe) that He-exalted be the glory of our Lord-) and that the dominion of our Lord is exalted; it is also said this means: the tremendousness, sovereignty, absoluteness and attributes of our Lord are far exalted, and He (hath taken neither wife nor son) as the disbelievers claim,
